net.sf.opengroove.common.security
Class Crypto

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.opengroove.common.security.Crypto

public class Crypto
extends Object

this class provides methods for encoding a byte array with a size of up to 65535 bytes as an AES-encoded byte array. The methods on this class take care of adding and removing padding as necessary.

Author:
Alexander Boyd

                       byte[] message,
                       OutputStream stream)

Encrypts the message specified, using the aes key specified, to the stream specified, with some header information that allows the length of the packet to be determined.

Parameters:
key -
message -

Throws:
IOException

dec

public static byte[] dec(DE.knp.MicroCrypt.Aes256 c,
                         InputStream message,
                         int limit)
                  throws IOException
Decodes a message from the stream specified. Multiple messages can be on this stream, and can be sequentially decrypted by calling this method on the same stream a bunch of times. If the message received is larger than limit, an exception is thrown. This is because, since the message length is not encrypted, an attacker could alter the message length to be some astronomically large value, thereby causing an OutOfMemoryError when a byte[] of that length is constructed.

Parameters:
key - the key to use for decryption
message - an InputStream containing the message
Returns:
the decrypted message
Throws:
IOException
